hi

i for one am sick to death of the persisten "if you read this youl probably cry" or the "read this if your a nice guy if your a jerk fuck off" these are the stupidest things you will ever read posted by serious losers. a great poet once said "sentimentality is the absence of feeling" get over the fact people are trying to tell how to interect and get of your loser arse computers and interact with actual people not a computer screen. and that fucking thing about the guy that rapes the girl? stop using it along with lines like and boy who does this should be killed rape is already a crime and any girl should be smart enough to have an idea that one of her friends unless under the influence of a psychosis is planning to do. get over yourselves and grow up!

poetry

open letter to pan.netusers, this is not a forum for you poorly constructed piss poor poetry. do any of you under stand what poetic devices are? and is there any danger of someone writing one that not line after line of wah wah wah? take a valium and realise the worlds not an ugly place, so stop filling it with your crap please.

little poem

the winds out side howling,
telling secrets to the seasons,
im in here whispering sweet nothings to my dreams,
dreams that shall remain nameless, faceless and unrequited,
so that when the wind fades and the seasons change our secrets will be safe

a little poem

breath it in, take it down, cage it
thats joy, a feeling of freedom and hope
lock it uo in your heart, a beautiful dungeon with no key

wild and elusive, chasing joy is no fools errand
not for the the weak at heart
a life's work, a life long pursuit
but when completed, you will have your opus

poem

how can you sit there staring at me/
eyes so blissfully listless and dull
im the best you have, misery loves company right?
youl never be found alone
in the light so lovable and worth is she,
behind closed doors, with out a shard of light
so loveable and tender is she, locked in her chest is her heart,
bosom pounding and hbod quivering she invites you in,
a taste as sweet as her kiss, she gives just that,
a taste, a snipet of what she hides,
never to see the light of day, nor the light of her prince
